intro: Daphnopsis americana subsp. ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian daphnopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and compact growth habit. The plant typically produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are often pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests at higher elevations. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
